[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/magic_header.rs] [Function: new()] [Configuration Injection] Can an attacker manipulate the MagicHeaderCheckerConfig during deserialization to inject malicious header keys containing control characters, newlines, or NULL bytes that could bypass validation or cause header parsing confusion? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/magic_header.rs] [Function: check()] [Header Validation] Does the header lookup at line 33 handle HTTP header name normalization correctly, or can attackers bypass validation by using non-standard capitalization, Unicode equivalents, or whitespace in header names? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/magic_header.rs] [Function: check()] [Unicode Normalization] Can attackers bypass the header value check by using Unicode normalization attacks (e.g., combining characters, homoglyphs, or different Unicode representations of the same visual character)? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/magic_header.rs] [Function: check()] [Whitespace Handling] Does the comparison trim or normalize whitespace, allowing attackers to bypass validation by adding leading/trailing spaces, tabs, or other whitespace characters to the header value? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/magic_header.rs] [Function: check()] [Encoding Attacks] Can attackers bypass validation by URL-encoding, Base64-encoding, or hex-encoding the header value, exploiting potential automatic decoding in the HTTP framework? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/magic_header.rs] [Function: check()] [NULL Byte Injection] Can attackers inject NULL bytes in the header value to truncate the comparison string early, making 'secret\\x00garbage' match 'secret' in C-style string comparisons? (High)
